activity: Grand opening of the natural playground
quote: Any gathering that is open to our community is an important way to foster good will in the community.
It has led to more people, including children, participating by playing music or singing. It has brought people together so they get to know each other better.

Unique to this event was the opportunity to get to know neighbours from surrounding streets - people whom we knew to see as they walked down our street and now we had a chance to say hello and become acquainted. Reiterates the supports we provide to each other including a wonderful sense of community.

We now have a new gathering area in our community.  We are looking forward to using this area at least once a month from March to October.  The group is small but enthusiastic and already new friendships are developing through it.

activity: Planting food forest in Victoria Park.
quote: The food forest will add to the diversity of trees and plants already in the park. In addition, the food forest provides free, healthy food for the taking.
One family in particular joined us for the first time - allowing us the chance to make introductions with other neighbours. New connections!
Helps neighbours connect to one another. Helps people see the park is a great gathering/meeting space at all times of the day/year.
The Stanley Park Community Association provided the film and snacks. A trip to a commercial movie theatre for a family of four can be very pricey.

activity: Holiday Potluck and Annual General Meeting.
quote: Anytime we can bring neighbours together, especially in a casual event (with food!), neighbourhood connections are strengthened.

Many people connect with the church congregation, whether just for the day, or for a longer period of time. Friendships are sparked, and families are introduced to the social services offered by the church.

Gave neighbours a chance to connect, especially over the winter when we tend to hide out in our houses. It allowed the neighbourhood to connect with some recently arrived refugee children from Reception House.
Some people visited the community centre for the first time, met others in their neighbourhood and enjoyed a fun activity.
Our little slice of downtown Kitchener pie desires to engage neighbours in meaningful connections to build a strong community where each member feels known and valued.
We hold a neighbourhood potluck every Wednesday. We have been doing this for years. It is a wonderful way to engage neighbours.

This was really exciting! With the help of FON, we were expecting maybe 10 -15 participants. Our final tally was around 40 people. Parents were excited to attend an event close to their home and there is talk about other events that we can organize!
Removal of litter makes the neighborhood more appealing to view.

activity: Annual Earth Day Community Clean Up
quote: Had approx 35 people come out and clean up along the trail and pond between Janine cresent and Fairway road. 18 bags of garbage collected in approx 1 hour. Met some new families and reconnected with former connections.

Had approx 35 people come out and clean up along the trail and pond between janine cres and fairway road. 18 bags of garbage collected in approx 1 hour. Met some new families and reconnected with former connections.

This gathering was the kick-starter our neighbourhood needed to revitalize our association's social/community events. The overwhelming support of this event is the added motivation we needed to plan and promote other neighbourly events!

Finally came face to face with neighbors. I feel as though I opened the door for further opportunities to host small events for our neighborhood friends. I feel as though we have all connected on a deeper level and will look out for each other.

activity: Earth Day -Parkvale Park Street Clean up
quote: Brought awareness to the community that littering is unacceptable and we need to do our part in maintaining the area. Keep it safe and a desirable place to live.
Yes the clean up would help the environment and definitely made an improvement in our neighbourhood. We collected 60 bags of garbage!
We keep in touch with one another and know our neighbours names, and strengths.
Environmentally conscious activity for our community.

activity: KENA and Central Frederick Garden Swap and Sale

quote: This activity is using DANCE to transform King East neighbourhood for a magical weekend!

I know more neighbours than before (and it has already reflected in the "hellos" of people who pass my house!)... and it was very helpful to gather/gauge interest from our community for future events we hope to plan.

activity: Neighbours Day Celebration and Garage Sale

quote: More awareness of the Victoria Park food forest and sharing of resources, community gardening tips, reducing waste, etc.
Encouraged people to animate this space 'after hours', at night. Showcased a great community space and encouraged people to engage with it in a way that maybe they had not before.

This annual activity is all-inclusive and suitable for people of all ages.  Even if neighbours did not organize a sale themselves, they were able to get out of their homes to check out what others were selling and chat with those that live in the neighbourhood.

Helped neighbours connect with others. Encouraged people to think about neighbourhoods and identify assets of a particular area/neighbourhood. Connected people to a great community resource by holding it in the Downtown Community Centre (which people still say they just discovered its existence).

Most of us have been here a very long time and don't leave unless they take us away in an ambulance. Our children have grown up together and we have all supported each other through births, weddings, grandchildren, retirement and deaths. The few that have moved away often return for our annual picnic. These events help families feel that their "older" parents are in a safe and secure neighbourhood and that allows them to remain in their homes for many years longer.
Annual Festival that provices an opportunity for many folks to interact in a safe and fun setting
It provided a safe and fun activity to bring the neighbourhood together.
It provided a safe and fun activity to bring the neighbourhood together
It provided a safe and fun free activity to bring the neighbourhood together.
It provided a safe and fun activity to bring the neighbourhood together
133 children drove through the bike safety course. Each child received a 'drivers licence' along with a small gift bag.
Encouraging people to use an underused space to connect with the space and others.
Many people move out every year so we want to reconnect with the new nad the old neighbours!
Helping neighbours develop stronger relationships through playing games.

Forest Hill's volunteers open the church for all to use without mention of religion. Volunteers interact and welcome 'guests' with no other agenda than to strengthen the community through regular interaction in a friendly environment.
Settler's Grove invited all neighbours and a chance to interact and engage with fellow neighbours.
More kids are playing outside because they have a place to play, the GAGA Ball Court!

activity: Summer Lights Movie Under the Stars
quote: Movie + Popcorn + Food Trucks + Games + Karaoke-Sing Along= AMAZINGSAUCE!!!

We are in need of a community centre or more city of Kitchener support for our community, we have a lot of youth and nowhere for them to go. And older adults will become excluded due to lack of community supports within our area of Kitchener.
This community was for clean-up of our amazing community that we all call home!
Grove residences. A chance for all neighbours to get together and enjoy a fun morning of searching for Easter eggs
Event was for all Settlers Grove residences. A chance for all neighbours to get together and sell their unwanted items.
A chance for all neighbours to get together and enjoy an inclusive celebration of each other and our amazing communityeach other and our amazing community.
It was a very positive event. We gained two new board members. It was a nice way of running a party around an AGM. Proud that it was innovative.
The celebration provided a safe and fun activity to bring the neighbourhood together

Darlingfest is our biggest community event and so many of our community members offer to come out and volunteer their time during this event, whether to hand out pizza, help with raffle tickets or keep track of prizes given out at the game stations.

Invited everyone that had a Hawksview home and for the homes that are still being built we asked the real estate agent to forward on the email to them. Everyone received an invite at the door and we spoke with 90% of the people because most were home at the time we went. Will attached the photo that has most of the people in it. Also invited the real estate agent that sells the new homes and his family who all came (they took the picture ) as well as invited the foremans of Hawksview.
This event was a chance for Muslim neighbours to take part in a collective act of kindness towards their neighbours and to educate them about one their most cherished practices in an intimate way.
All the kids in the complex out participating having fun.
We held a Jane's walk to share our vision of community gardens in Forest Heights. This had about 75 multigenerational/mulit cultural individuals joined us to hear about our vision for Forest Heights.
This was a totally green initiative, the pollinator fedge enhances the local environment by providing habitat and food for native pollinators.
It has made then neighbourhood greener, more visually appealing, and gave youth a sense of belonging and invovlement in the community.

The better people know their neighbours, the happier they are on their street, the more they are willing to help out one another and the more peaceful life can be in a neighbourhood. One really exciting thing that happened is when we asked for volunteers to put a lawn sign on their lawn, new people came out of the wood work showing their enthusiasm for the garage sale and our community association! Some of these people have since been engaging on our Facebook page!

The shed looks so great in the park and families that participated love seeing their hand print and initials on there to last forever! It makes the shed everyone's shed which is definitely a wonderful way to create a sense of community in everyone. As said above, we see kids going up to find their hand print all of the time and to show the people they are at the park with!
We are hoping to continue our quest for greater heritage recognition in our community. We are hoping to have a historical map placed in the neighbourhood hopefully by the Grand River or in the Park.
This was the first community neighbourhood association choir that we are aware of!  It involved all walks of life and ages!
This was a no charge event, every child left with a present and after a visit with the worlds greatest Santa and everyone had pizza and drinks!

This was a great free event!  It was an interactive event that looked at the history of the FHCA and the FHCC, and encouraged parents to be interactive as well with their children.  Each child also left with a goody bag of Easter based treats!

The inclusive nature, we had one choir member who participated in a wheel chair and the church was wheel chair accessible.  This was also, like all of our other events, free to all, as it was sponsored by the FHCA!

This involved so many community partners, the city of Kitchener, Neighbourhood Strategy, KPL, Kitchener Fire, Forest Hill T Ball, and many community sponsors.  Plus the mayor, ward councillors, you name it, they were there!  It was awesome, inclusive, safe, and just fun!
We have had a lot of response to the event. People are already talking about next year! We were very happy with the amount of food that we gathered for the food bank, and can't wait to host again.
There were many people that happily participated and that everyone, young and old, had a great time.
People have decluttered thir home and met new neighbours.
It allowed people to meet the neighbours.
Bringing the children together for the new school year during a PD day.

activity: Janes Walk-East to West Along Breithaupt Street
quote: Love talking about the history of manufacturing in Kitchener.  The players of our past were so colourful.

activity: Earthday Clean Up Spur Line Trail
quote: We were very happy to see so many people come out to clean up the trail.  THe community really wants to ensure the trail is kept clean.
Afternoon movies are a great way to spend the afternoon. All are invited to attend, regardless of age, ethnicity to come out and watch the BCA newest movie pick.

A great event for Kindergarten to Grade 6 children to spend time with their friends, dancing and having some fun in a safe, friendly environment. Parents accompanying their children have a chance to dance with them and have an opportunity to socialize with other parents in the neighbourhood.

a collaborative event with the BCA, Brownies, Lions, Bridgeport Quilters and the Bridgeport Men’s Coffee Group all working together to bring the community together to share the holiday season and decorate a tree with Santa. Donations of non-perishable food is collected at the event.
Afternoon movies are a great way to spend the afternoon. All are invited to attend, regardless of age, ethnicity to come out and watch the BCA newest movie pick.

Great opportunity for Bridgeporters to reconnect and meet newcomers. Whether they have only lived in Bridgeport for three months or were third generation, all past and present residents of Bridgeport and their families were invited to attend. The day ended with a potluck supper at 4:30 pm.

Everyone was welcome to join in the activities offered for Family Day to connect with their family members and other residents in the neighbourhood.

It is nice to be able to walk down the street and smile at people you now recognize after events like this! It helps it feel a little more friendly and welcoming when you know and recognize friendly faces.

Earth Day Clean Up events like ours help create pride in the neighbourhood, it encourages others to do the smae. Then kids start doing it, then thre is no trash ecause people take pride. It keeps the neighbourhoods cleaner for our kids to play in. It also encouraged others to start their own small gruops.
Food truck, soccer, pickleball and a live blues band. People wondering when next one will be taking place.

For our Neighbours Day, we brought all of the soapbox derby cars out and let all kids sit in them. We chatted with parents over coffee. We loved seeing some of the new Syrian Refugee kids taking part.
It was great to have a rather uneventful event. Close racing. Winner literally won by an inch.
It was so great to see how many people had fun doing this event. I have heard for weeks about how much people enjoyed it, and how they would love to do it again next year, which we will do.

Money raised by this event donates most of the event money to our Natural Playground fundraiser. This fundraiser is raising money to expand our natural playground, which is used by our entire community!
Cleaning up our area makes it a more inviting space and makes it a healthy home for our animal friends!

The different vessels people used to try soups ie. muffin tin, tasting everyones creations, apples and caramel, watching the kids do pumpkin crafts.
